direction.raw_text: The cabin is neither cramped nor spacious, but about the size of the President's cabin in Air Force One. In the immediate f.g. is a console of dials and switches flanked by four chairs. Only one of the chairs is occupied. The astronaut's back is to CAMERA. There is a ladder amidships which leads to an escape hatch. The after Dart of the cabin is obscured in darkness. We hear the MUSIC of a Mozart sonata emanating from a phonograph of stereotape. The astronaut is speaking into a microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the sixth month of our flight from Cape Kennedy. By our time, that is ... He pauses, looking up at: 3
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Within the hour we shall complete
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ON CABIN WALL One clock is marked SELF TIME, but instead of twelve numerals it has twenty-four. One of the needles is moving very slowly. The other clock is labeled EARTH TIME, and its units, like those of a tachometer, are given by hundreds and thousands. The largest needle of this clock makes one revolution every second. Over this we hear:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) But according to Dr. Hasslein theory of time in a vehicle traveling at close to the speed of light, old Mother Earth has aged a few thousand years since our de- parture -- while we have scarcely aged at all. 4
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: This is TAYLOR. He wears simple dungarees (or Churchill suit) and comfortable boots. He seems calm and pensive. Extracting the butt of a cigar from the breast pocket of his dungarees, he lights it, then continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He begins to roll up his left sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He removes the cigar from his mouth, turns to look out through one of the portholes into the astral night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He extracts a hypodermic needle from his breast pocket and injects it into the vein of his forearm. He continues speaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor withdraws the hypodermic needle from his vein and secures it in a drawer of the console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor snuffs out the cigar butt and places it in the drawer beside the hypodermic. Then, flicking a switch Au cut off the Mozart, he rises and looks up again at: 5
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It may be so. This much is probable: the men who sent us on this journey have long since been moldering in forgotten graves; and those, if any, who read this message are a different breed. Hopefully, a better one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I leave the twentieth century without regret. Who was it? Marshall? ... said 'Modern man is the missin 'a link between the ape and the human being.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One final thought -- nothing scientific, purely personal. Seen from up here, everything looks different ... Time bends and space is boundless. It squashes a man's ego. He begins to feel like no more than a mote in the eye of eternity. And he is nagged by a question: ahat if any- thing, will greet us on the end of man's first journey to a star? Are we to believe that throughout these thousands of galaxies, these millions of stars, only one, that speck of solar dust we call Earth, has been graced -- or cursed -- by human life? (pause) I have to doubt it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sardonically) That's about all. I wonder if Man, that marvel of the universe, that glorious paradox who has sent me to the unknown... still makes war against his brother., and lets his neighbor's children starve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well then, Earthmen: A missing link salutes you. Bless you, my descendants.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The longest needle of this clock now makes nearly two revolutions per second. The shortest needle points to the numeral 2105. 6
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Space scientists have presumably solved the problem of weightlessness, for Taylor walks the short distance from; the console to the after section without particular effort. CAMERA FOLLOWS him, and we can now see four glass capsules, or "caskets", in the rear of the cabin. Taylor looks down at them. 7-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S - THE FOUR CASKETS - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. 10 One of them is open. The other three are occupied by astronauts: DODGE, LANDON and STEWART. They, too, wear dungarees and boots. Dodge and Landon are thirtyish, clean-shaven, virile -- America's finest. Stewart is a handsome young woman, her hair bobbed short. Their eyes are closed and they do not appear to be breathing -- yet no undertaker could make them so alive. 11
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grasps the handle of his own casket and slowly pulls himself into it. Continuing SILENCE. CAMERA MOVES IN as Taylor Dulls the glass lid shut and secures it. He adjusts two dials inside the capsule and lies back, buckling his safety belt. CAMERA MOVES INTO A CLOSEUP of Taylor. His eyes are open. He seems serene, even enraptured. (NOTE: Credits will appear here over a series of shots designed to convey a sense of loneliness, of separation, and of the passage of time.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A DISTANT GLOBE (MINIATURE) 16 We see a strange and distant planet. At first the globe occupies but a small area of the screen; but with each new VIEW it comes closer and looms larger, as if" observed from a spaceship in a spiraling orbit of descent. The topography of the planet bears little resemblance to our own. Much of it is obscured by cloud cover; even more of-it appears to be cratered desert of reddish hue. We can, however, make out a few narrow "green belts" and a patch of blue water. In the FINAL SHOTS of this SEQUENCE we see the strange planet as it would be observed from a spacecraft plummeting from twenty thousand feet to one thousand feet. It appears that the ship will fall into a vast lake surrounded by soaring sandstone pinnacles. The water is blue-black, the pinnacles vermillion. (This is the Lake Powell location, at Lone Rock.) 17
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four empty pilot seats are seen in f.g., the four glass caskets in b.g. We HEAR the RHYTHMIC BLEAT of a WARNING SIGNAL, a RUSH OF WIND as in a rapid descent, and perhaps the ROAR OF RETROJETS. Then, a great CRASH as the craft hits water. The whole ship shudders on impact. Loose equipment falls to the cabin floor. CAMERA MOVES DOWN the cabin aisle as the ship begins to roll in the water and HOLDS on the four glass caskets. There are THREE LOUD METALLIC CLICKS as the glass domes of the caskets swing open automatically. 18
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He now has a full beard. His eyes come open. Instantly alert, he rises to a sitting position, gazing across at: 19
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. They, too, awaken and sit up, starring at Taylor. They, too, are bearded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They nod. 20
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) You all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CLOSE SHOT He glances at the casket beside his own.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stewart? (struggling to his feet) Stewart? 21
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -SHOT --THE FOURTH CASKET Its dome remains unopened. The young woman is a skeleton in a Churchill suit. 22
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge and Landon have joined Taylor and-stare at the grinning skull of their dead comrade. A low, descending HUM of equipment is heard. Simultaneously the lights begin to FADE. A moment later they brighten, but not as much as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slight CRACKING sound is heard. Taylor turns quickly away and o.s.: 23
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There goes our primary power. We're on auxilliary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A trickle of water has begun to seep through a ruptured seam in the cabin. Taylor darts to a porthole and peers cut. 24
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : water The porthole is no more than six inches above the line. In the distance we discern a shoreline of red desert.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) We're in the soup. We're sinking. 25
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The leak in the seam becomes a growing spray of water. Taylor turns away from the porthole, calling:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge moves instantly to the ladder beneath an escape hatch and mounts it. Taylor stumbles down the aisle of the rolling ship toward the console and addresses Landon, who is still staring at Stewart's skeleton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Landon lurches toward the communications equipment in f.g.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dodge! Read the atmosphere!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Landon! Send a last signal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dazed) What signal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To Earth! That we've landed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We are looking at a lifeless desert of sandstone buttes and pinnacles. There is no sign of vegetation anywhere. CAMERA PANS DOWN to a body of water that could be the bay of an inland sea. The deep blue of the sea contrasts sharply to the red sands of the shoreline. CAMERA HOLDS on the stricken spaceship, wallowing like a beached whale a hundred yards offshore. The portholes of the craft are beneath the water, and only its roof and the tail fin of its tail assembly are visible. The red-hot skin of the ship vaporizes the water around it. Suddenly a snorkel-like tube sprouts from the escape hatch, which is located amidships. 27
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge, standing halfway up the ladder., has fastened a kit of gauges to the end of the snorkel tube. He reads the dials, removes the kit, sniffs the air in the tube and then, taking a deep breath, announces:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge reaches for a control mechanism near the escape hatch. 28
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's breathable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Okay! Blow the hatch before we lose auxilliary power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The spray of water coming through the ruptured seam is increasing. The LIGHTS DIM again and the SOUND of the warning signal FADES. While Landon fiddles with the radio, Taylor tries to get the tape recorder rolling, but all we hear are scrambled and unintelligible noises.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's no use ... there she goes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it. Abandon ship. 29
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TIM CABIN The escape hatch is now open. Taylor darts over to the ladder and passes a folded life raft up to Dodge. When Landon reaches the ladder, Taylor hands him two neatly packed rucksacks, and Landon climbs through the escape hatch. Taylor is about to follow with a third rucksack, then turns and crosses the cabin for a last look at: 30
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. Both clocks have stopped: the red needle of the clock labeled SELF TIME rests on the numeral 18; the red needle of the clock marked EARTH TIME rests on the numeral 3975. 31
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge inflates the raft with a cartridge of compressed air and tosses it into the water. He and Landon jump into the water and climb onto the raft as Taylor emerges from the hatch, Taylor slips into the water and climbs onto the raft. He and Landon begin to paddle toward shore, while Dodge immediately opens another kit and takes a sample of the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (half to himself) Briny...twenty-five percent salinity. Near the saturation point.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (looking back) She's still sinking... 33
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM THEIR P.O.V. Only the radio antenna and the tip of the tail fin remain visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The craft vanishes beneath the water. 34
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Going ... going...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dodge is still busy with his kit. Landon is still looking back, but Taylor doesn't bother to turn his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flatly) We're here to stay. 35
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They gaze at the forbidding sandstone battlements as they near the shore.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well? Where are we? Have any notion, skipper?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confidently) We're some three hundred and twenty light years from Earth. On an unnamed planet in orbit around a star in the constellation of Orion. (looks off at the "sun") That could be Bellatrix. 36
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM THEIR P.O.V. Low on the horizon, seen through a dense envelope of dust particles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Too red for Bellatrix. 37
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Landon glances skeptically at Taylor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't have time to check the tapes, so you don't really know, do you? (as Taylor ignores him) What went wrong? (sardonically) We weren't programmed to land in water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grinning) The question, Landon, is not so much where we are as when we are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stands up in raft) We've had a nice snooze. Let's start earning all our back pay. 38
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE BEACH As the three astronauts step out into shallow water and pull the raft ashore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge moves inland about ten yards, removes a small hand drill from his belt, extends the rod of the drill three feet and begins to take some subsoil samplings. Taylor begins to examine the contents of the three rucksacks. Landon sits down on the beach., hands around his knees, gazing moodily at the sunken spaceship. During this and succeeding scenes we sense that Dodge's obsession with scientific inquiry leaves him immune to fear: Landon is possibly more courageous and certainly more "human," for he has many fears to control: while Taylor -- detached, cool and misanthropic -- is something of an enigma.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Take your soil test, Dodge. I'll check the equipment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calls Dodge) Got your sensors?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Geiger counter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking inventory) One pistol... twenty-four rounds of ammo. two medical kits.. one camera... one TX9. (loudly to the others) We've enough food and water for three days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But how long is a day?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good question. (turning) Landon -- check your communications kit. 39
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He seems not to have heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon involuntarily touches the gray hair of his temple as Taylor adds lightly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge enters scene. A handful of reddish sand dribbles through his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He picks up one of the rucksacks and puts it on. The others follow suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves out. Dodge follows. CAMERA PANS with them. They have gone only a few paces when Taylor looks back over his shoulder and halts. 40
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) Landon! Join the expedition.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) Sorry... (crossing to his kit) I was thinking of Stewart. What d'you suppose happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flatly) Air leak. Died in her sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't seem very cut up about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a little late for a wake. She's been dead nearly a year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we've been away from Earth for eighteen months.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By our time. (smiling at Landon) You've turned gray.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Apart from that, you look pretty chipper for a man who's two thousand and thirty one years old. (casually) I read the clocks. They bear out Hasslein's hypothesis. We've been away from Earth for two thousand years, give or take a decade. (pause) Still can't accept it, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: long pause) You know it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because time has wiped out everyone and everything you cared for -- they're dust.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Prove it. If we can't get back, it's still just a theory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a fact, Landon. Buy it. You'll sleep better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing will grow here .... there's just a trace of hydrocarbons, and most of the nitrogen is locked into nitrates.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any sign of dangerous ionization?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) Okay. If there's no life here, we've got just seventy-two hours to find it. That's when the groceries run out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which direction?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (decisively, pointing west) That way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any particular reason?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: None at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Landon is squatting in the sand, sticking something into the soil. It is a small American flag, the size of a handkerchief. 41
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mirth bubbles up in Taylor's throat. He explodes with wild laughter. He is still laughing as they move out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (GUNSIGHT
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They descend from the plateau (Ochre Dunes) 43
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Across the top of the hills there suddenly runs a line of fire (Black Dunes). 44
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jagged bolts of lightning flash across the sky, but bring, no rain, and thunder claps sound like heavy artillery. (Gray Area) 45-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - GROUP SHOT - DAY Several huge boulders are dislodged, and the three astronauts run. wildly to escape the falling rocks. When the avalanche ends, they sprawl on the lifeless sands, breathing heavily and drenched with sweat, surrounded by enormous boulders. Taylor looks about him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murmurs of assent from Dodge and Landon. Taylor rummages through a limp rucksack, comes up with some empty food cartons,rummages again, coming up with a cigar butt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge lies back and looks up at the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon also looks up at the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor turns to Dodge, throws up his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge rises and moves off, o.s., either embarrassed by this colloquy or unwilling to hear it again. Taylor, cigar clamped between his teeth, spins toward Landon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you -- TAYLOR Oh, and one last item. Immortality. You wanted to go on forever. (pause) Well, you damn near made it. Except for Dodge and me, you've lived longer than anybody. And with Stewart dead, it looks like we're the last of the strain. You got what you wanted, kid. How does it taste? Silence.        Taylor lies down, spent of his venom, pillowing his head on a rucksack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor's eyes are closed. He is silent for a moment. When he speaks, his tone is soft, reflective.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Everybody all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Water check. Dodge takes a plastic canteen from another rucksack and inspects it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eight ounces.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't add up. There's a mantle of dust around this planet and yet it's as humid as a jungle. Thunder and lightning and yet no rain. Cloud cover every night and that strange luminosity, and yet no moon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If only we could get a fix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (needling him) What would you learn? I've told you where you are and when you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gently) Taylor -- quit riding him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (harshly, to Landon) You're more than three hundred light years from your precious planet. Your loved ones have been dead and forgotten for twenty centuries. Even if you could get back, they'd think you were something that fell out of a tree.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wearily) All right -- TAYLOR There's only one reality left. We're here and it's now. You get ahold of that and hang on tight, or you might as well be dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) I'm prepared to die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's prepared to die! Doesn't that make you misty? Chalk up another victory for the human spirit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Straighten me out on something. Why did you come along at all? You volunteered. Why? (a beat; no answer) I'll tell you. They nominated you for the Big One and you couldn't turn it down. Not without losing your All-American standing
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hard) Climb off me, will you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the glory, don't forget that. There's a life-sized bronze statue of you somewhere. It's probably turned green by now, and nobody can read the name plate. But never let it be said we forget our heroes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Taylor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Okay. You read me well enough. Why can't I read you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't bother
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking off) Dodge ... he's not like me at all. But he makes sense. Held walk naked into a live volcano if he thought he could learn something no other man knew. I understand why  he's here. But you...You're no seeker. You're negative.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I'm not prepared to die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (heatedly) I'd like to know why not. You thought life on Earth was meaningless. You despised people. So what did you do? You ran away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, not quite, Landon. I'm a bit of a seeker myself. But my dreams are a lot emptier than yours. (pause) I can't get rid of the idea that somewhere in the Universe there must be a creature superior to man. 60
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: who has been wandering around, studying the boulders and the barren soil. Taylor and Landon can be seen in b.g. Dodge spots something and squats down to examine it. 61

direction.raw_text: His parched lips break into a smile.

direction.raw_text: The cascade has formed a cool and inviting pool. Thick foliage grows to its very edge. Dodge is on his hands and knees, testing the liquid with his kit. The others wait expectantly.

Suddenly and inexplicably a pair of dungarees slithers away into the underbrush. A few seconds pass. Now a pair of bronzed and brawny shoulders fill the SCREEN, blocking our view. 86
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or is it human? The hair is matted, the face bearded, the jaw prognathous, the orbital rim prominent. 87

Suddenly he seizes Taylor's arm and points silently at the far bank of the pool. 89        WHAT THEY SEE: Another pair of dungarees slithers into the underbrush and disappears. 90
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE ASTRONAUTS Led by Taylor, they dive back into the pool and swim to the other bank. Emerging from the water, they look around in bewilderment. Taylor makes hand signals to indicate absolute silence and a reconnaissance. The three astronauts fan out and move cautiously into the jungle (or rain forest). 91- 93

direction.raw_text: reacting. They speak in whispers.

dialogue.raw_text: (warmly) Greetings! 98

direction.raw_text: - THE STRANGE CREATURES - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. There are perhaps a dozen of them. They shrink back as Taylor advances -- hostile, frightened or both. We now see that some of them are clutching articles of the astronauts' clothing and equipment. Taylor stops, stares at them glumly.

direction.raw_text: Taylor grimaces at Landon.

direction.raw_text: S - THE JUNGLE (OR RAIN FOREST): 105 A pistol goes off with a deafening crash, and the primitive creatures scatter in panicky flight. After a while, quiet returns to the jungle. 106
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They examine the remnants of their clothing and equipment and start to don whatever is able to be worn. Taylor puts on what remains of a ripped pair of trousers; Dodge starts to improvise from the remnants of the kit (it is a torn shelter half). Landon, like Taylor, has the remains of his pants.

direction.raw_text: This need not be a cultivated grove. A few trees (peach or apricot or avocado, it matters not) grow wild in a pleasant glade. Nor is the grove extensive. The three astronauts sit under a tree in f.g.; the primitives sit under a clump, of trees some fifty yards away. Each camp is feeding and warily watching the other. In the distance beyond the fruit trees is an open grassy plain or cultivated field. 108
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FROM LANDON'S P.O.V. They too are sitting under trees, munching fruit. There are no more than a dozen altogether. 109
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CLOSE GROUP SHOT TAYLOR Well, at least they haven't tried to bite us.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Blessed are the vegetarians. 110
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FEATURING A YOUNG WOMAN Squatting on her haunches, eating fruit, gazing back at Taylor. Her hair is long and black, her skin nut brown, her face hauntingly lovely and hauntingly stupid. This is NOVA. 111
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon looks o.s. at the primitives.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We got off at the wrong stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're our optimist Look at the bright side. If that's the best there is around here, in six months we'll be running this planet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suddenly) Look... 112
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - THEIR P.O.V. They appear to be agitated although neither we nor the astronauts have yet heard or seen any cause for alarm. The primitives get to their feet, sniffing, listening 113

direction.raw_text: Cut off from their natural habitat, they reverse direction and flee toward the tall grasses of the savanna (or cultivated field). 118

direction.raw_text: GROUP SHOT - THE THREE ASTRONAUTS Stupefied, frozen in place. 120

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - A RIDER He reins in, raises his rifle and fires. For the first time, we se that he is a GORILLA. He wears a simple quasi-military uniform -- tunic, trousers and boots. 126
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running through the high grass. He is shot in the back and falls. 127

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE SHOT - THE SAVANNA - FEATURING A LINE OF BEATERS The beaters are all GORILLAS. They carry long sticks and nets, and their task is to flush out the terrified primitives cowering in the tall grass. 130-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE HUNTERS AND THE HUNTED: 135 (a)        Landon flees from one rider only to be cut off by another. He stumbles and a rearing stallion tramples him. (b)        A third mounted gorilla flings a net over a running female. She is hopelessly entangled. This is Nova. (c)        Landon lies unconscious on the grassy plain, an ugly gash on his forehead. (d)        Taylor crawls through the tall grass on his hands and knees. A rider crosses his path without seeing him. (e)        The beaters close in on Taylor, blocking his escape route. (f)        Taylor changes direction and decides to run for it. 136
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - PANNING WITH TAYLOR Bent low, he flees through the tall grass. A SHOT rings out. Taylor falls. 137
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lying on his back. His fingers go to his throat. Blood appears between his fingers. He opens his mouth in pain, but no sound comes forth, as Taylor sinks into unconsciousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hunting party has reassembled here beneath the fruit trees. Some of the gorillas have dismounted; others are still on horseback. In the middle distance is a crude horse-drawn wagon. The sides and top of the wagon form a wire cage. Three captive males and one female are visible within the cage. Dodge and Landon are nowhere to be seen. Two gorilla porters enter scene, dragging a male human corpse by the ankles, as two other bearers enter scene with a living burden on a long carrying pole. Taylor dangles from the pole, held aloft by the bonds around his wrists and ankles. CAMERA PANS with the two gorillas as they dump Taylor into the wagon and close the tail gate. 139-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WITHIN WAGON CAGE His throat is smeared with blood. His eyelids flutter as he regains consciousness. 142
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Three primitive males bound hand and foot. They seem docile in captivity. The female, Nova, clasps bound wrists around her bound ankles and gazes blankly at Taylor. There is a JOLT of MOVEMENT as the wagon gets underway 143
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a great effort he raises himself on one elbow and looks out from the cage. 144
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WHAT TAYLOR SEES: A gorilla hunter stands over a dead man, one foot planted he chest of his kill and his rifle butt resting on the on   abdomen. Facing him is another gorilla with an old-fashioned camera on a tripod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hunter bares his teeth. 145
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Smile.

direction.raw_text: He faints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A SURGERY - ANGLING DOWN ON TWO OPERATING TABLES NIGHT The surgery is dimly-lit. (If possible we should be unaware of the source of illumination.) Taylor lies strapped to the nearer table. He appears to be unconscious. The young female captive, Nova, is strapped to the table beside him. She is conscious. Taylor is receiving a direct blood transfusion from her. Hovering over Taylor are a NURSE and a surgeon named GALEN. Both are chimpanzees. Galen wears a bloody surgical apron, the nurse a white smock. Galen is removing a filthy bandage from Taylor's neck. A door behind them opens and DR. ZIRA, an animal psychologist,        enters. She, too, is a chimpanzee and wears a smock like the nurse's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zira looks down at Taylor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen paws through a tray of surgical instruments. The equipment is obsolescent and the room untidy -- like that of a callous small-town veterinarian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She exits. Zira runs a forefinger across a dusty table.Her voice is soft and well-modulated.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Which one was wearing the strange clothes?

dialogue.raw_text: Him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) You don't sound happy in your work.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But the quota system's been abolished! You made it. Why can't I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean, made it? I'm an animal psychologist, that's all. We don't have any authority.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do pretty well when it comes to getting space and equipment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's because Dr. Zaius realizes our work has value.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmph.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The foundations of scientific brain surgery are being laid right here - in studies of cerebral function in these animals.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're still dirty. And their bite is septic. Look at that ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Nurse) Hold his head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cages are no larger than small jail cells. There are four of them. Bars, not walls, divide the cages, so that all four are visible. Each of the first three cages is occupied by a primitive male. At the moment the first two are quiet -- dozing or scratching apathetically. The third occupant is stolidly regarding a half-dozen brightly colored hollow wooden boxes, or blocks, Of varying sizes and proportions on the floor of his cage. He is trying to stack the boxes in such a way as to reach a banana dangling from a cord twelve feet overhead. He has correctly selected the first two large, sturdy blocks for his tower under the banana -- but the tall third block is too unstable on its small base to support the broad-based fourth block. 149-A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor, Looking much stronger, sits on a pile of dirty straw in the fourth cage. There is a clean bandage around his throat. He watches the block-building primitive with contemptous amusement. Both the third and fourth blocks tumble to the floor when the primitive tries to mount his tower. He stands there, staring dully at the scattered blocks, then up at the unattainable banana. 149-B
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - THE        LABORATORY A door at the end of the aisle opens and a gorilla named JULIUS enters, dressed in a keeper's uniform. He quickly closes the door, snatches up a broom, starts sweeping. Julius is obviously late for work. Taylor struggles to his feet, moves to the bars of the cage, tries to call out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three other primitives move toward the bars of their cages. Julius barks at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The third primitive goes back to stacking his blocks. Julius comes up to Taylor's cage, indicates a like set of blocks strewn across its floor, extends his broom handle to whack the banana overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He returns to his sweeping. Taylor glowers at him. A moment later, the door at the end of the aisle opens and Dr. Zira enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts down the aisle toward Taylor's cage. He grasps the bars, awaiting her anxiously. As she passes the second cage, the primitive in it shakes the bars, jumps up and down. His tongue is hanging out. Zira smiles, stops, digs into the pocket of her smock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The primitive continues to jump up and down energetically. Zira takes a cube of sugar from her pocket, holds it up for his inspection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man eagerly sticks his hand through the bars. She drops the cube in his hands. He jams it into his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves toward Taylor's cage, Julius behind her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (soundlessly) Hey! Hey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Simmer down! (points at Taylor) You especially.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Better give it a try, stupid. Unless you like going hungry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning, Dr. Zira.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning, Julius. How's our patient today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No change. The minute you open the door, he goes into his act.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (playfully) Well, what do we want this morning? Do we want something? Speak! Come on, speak!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do we want some sugar, old-timer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (concerned) You could get hurt doing that, Doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be silly. He's perfectly tame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're all tame until they take a chunk out of you. 150
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ZIRA AND JULIUS Taylor starts to open his mouth as Zira comes up to the bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He winces, puts his hand to the bandage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor glares at Julius, slams the bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zira hurriedly takes a pen and notebook from the breast Docket of her smock, starts to scribble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor is staring in silent fascination at the open and notebook.He stops mouthing, points at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor gestures for Zira to come closer to the bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She advances tentatively toward the cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor suddenly reaches through the bars, tries to snatch the pen and notebook from Zira. Julius instantly jabs his broom handle through the bars, hitting Taylor in the ribs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zira draws back, looking at Taylor in surprise. 151
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, Bright Eyes, is our throat feeling better?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (frantic mouthing) Listen, listen -- I can speak --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sympathetically) Awww, it still hurts, doesn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See? He keeps pretending he can talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mouthing) I'm not pretending! I can talk!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) Did you see that? It's remarkable!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's trying to form words.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you know what they say. Human see, human do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He seems to want something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd be careful, doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did I tell you! (to Taylor) Try that again, I'll break your arm!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R - TAYLOR His face is twisted in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over this a door is heard opening o.s., and Julius' voice, nervous, deferential:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor looks o.s. 152-
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (mouthing) What's the matter with you? I can talk! Can't you see that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Good morning, Your Excellency.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. Julius and Zira cross to a stout, imposing orangutan who has just entered the laboratory. Julius bows to him. This is DR. ZAIUS. Like the other apes, he wears a simple tunic and trousers, but his garments are of a Costlier material, and several decorations are woven into the sash of his tunic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius crosses with them to Taylor's cage. Beneath his austere manner, we sense tension, worry. Zira looks up at Taylor, her tone an appeal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor just glares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speak again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor turns to Zaius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zira wiggles her fingers excitedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius' voice is quiet, but there is steel in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor is frantically wiggling his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CLOSE - TAYLOR He is pleading silently as Zaius' voice is heard over the SHOT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CLOSE - ZAIUS A warning burns out of his eyes as he stares at Taylor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (bubbling) Dr. Zaius, I'm so glad you could come. He's over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bright Eyes, show him! Go ahead! Do your trick!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Speak! Go on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (silent mouthing) My - name - isn't - Bright Eyes It's Taylor!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There! Can you believe it? I looks like he's talking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (evenly) Yes, amusing. A man who acts like an ape.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (silent mouthing) I'm not acting! I can talk! How much proof do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thunderstruck) Dr. Zaius, I could have sworn he was answering you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding, but unmoved) He shows a definite gift for mimicry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wonder how held score on a Hopkins manual dexterity test?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An animal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's moving his fingers!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. He saw you moving yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But perhaps he understood -- 161-A
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s., hard) Man has no understanding, Dr. Zira. He can be taught a few simple tricks. Nothing more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) I beg to disagree. According to my exper- iments -- 161-B
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A word to the wise, Dr. Zira. Experimental brain surgery on these creatures is one thing. I'm all for it. 161-C
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R - TAYLOR Fear clouds his eyes. Abruptly, he stops moving his lips. 161-D
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE GROUP Zaius sees the effect his words have had on Taylor. He turns to Zira, goes on in a more detached tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But your behavioral studies are another matter entirely. To suggest that we can learn something about simian nature from a study of man is nonsense. Besides, men are a nuisance. They outgrow their own food supply in the forest and migrate to our green belts and ravage our crops. (looking casually at Taylor) The sooner they're exterminated, the better. He turns toward the door. A disappointed Zira follows him. Zaius looks back at Taylor just before going out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's a question of simian survival. 161-E
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He stares after Zaius, than looks away, slumps to the floor. A pause, then a VOICE is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor looks up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is this the one you wanted, Doctor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Yes, thank you. (pause, her voice much closer) Bright Eyes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) I've got a present for you. 161-F
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Standing outside the cage, held on a leash by an APE GUARD  is Nova. She looks at Taylor without expression. Zira gestures at JULIUS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius unlocks the cage door-, leads Nova inside, removes her leash and collar. Taylor has gotten to his feet. Julius goes out, locking the door behind him. Nova hesitates, then slowly reaches out, takes Taylor's hand. Zira beams at them. 162-
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Put her in with him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY It is nothing elaborate, A wire fence encloses a dirt yard. This compound is situated on the outskirts of Apetown and the town is visible in the distance. There are about a dozen adult human captives within the enclosure, no more than a third of them females. Some of them trudge around the dusty yard like convicts in a penitentiary. Others squat against the sun- drenched wall. A big male suddenly runs to the fence and tries to climb it. Several guides, armed with whips and torches, immediately close in on him. The primitive recoils in fear from a fiery torch and rejoins the captives' circle. 171
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE YARD - FEATURING TAYLOR He plods sullenly back and forth across the rear of the yard, occasionally glancing off toward the approaches to the compound. Nova is at his heels. He ignores her. Once again he looks off, stops suddenly. Nova bumps into him. He turns, impatiently shoos her away, then looks o.s., again. 172
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - TAYLOR'S P.O.V. Zira can be seen approaching with a young chimpanzee, DR. CORNELIUS. He wears a simple smock over his tunic and trousers. Cornelius glances surreptitiously around, covertly takes Zira's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives her a quick peck on the cheek. 173
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have to work tonight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Neither do I.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R - TAYLOR He drifts toward the fence, Nova behind him. 174
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come up to the fence. Zira nods toward Taylor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor stares at her impassively, then looks around to a that no guards are watching, hunkers down, begins to scratch in the dust. Nova extends unclean fingers to touch the bandage on his throat. Taylor flinches, pushes her hand away. Nova touches a bluish bruise on the inside of her own forearm, then searches for a similar bruise on Taylor's forearm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor looks up and o.s., quickly rises. 175
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's Bright Eyes. The one I was telling you about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's so special about him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch. (to Taylor) Hello, Bright Eyes. How's our throat today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) Look -- she remembers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remembers what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The blood transfusion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (peeved) Zira, come on. You know they can't -- (he stops, looking off) Oh oh. Here comes Number One.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FEATURING DR. ZAIUS Who is approaching the two scientists from deep b.g. Zaius is followed by a huge and much decorated gorilla Whom we recognize as the Leader of the Hunt Club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius bows respectfully. Zaius is patronizingly polite.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in a whisper, to Cornelius) Something's bothering him. He's been prying around the lab for the last two days ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as Zaius comes nearer) Good morning, Dr. Zaius. You know Dr. Cornelius, my fiance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yes -- the young ape with a shovel. I hear you're planning another archeological expedition. A-175
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He has stepped back from the marks he made in the-dust, is watching Zaius with concern.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Yes, sir. If the academy agrees.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) The project will require my support, of course. 176
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - ANGLING DOWN ON TAYLOR AND NOVA A primitive male squats down to see what Taylor has marked on the ground. In letters a foot high he has written:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nova, at once petulant and playful, erases the WRITE with a bare foot. Taylor angrily flings her aside. This violence provokes the primitive male, who snarls at Taylor and cuffs him. Over this we HEAR from a distance:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor slugs the snarling male, who wades in, trying to bite him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) I hope I can count on it, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s) A friendly warning, Cornelius -- when you're digging for artifacts, don't bury your reputation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Guards! 177
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE FIGHT Two gorilla guards rush in to break up the fight. One of them lashes out with his whip. The other pokes his torch at Taylor. Its flame brushes his arm. Taylor opens his mouth, gives a silent yell of pain, shrinks back. Zira runs to the fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prodding the malcreants with their torches, the two guards herd them toward a doorway in the wall. Zira hurries around the side of the fence and o.s. 178
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to guards) Stop! You've hurt him! Take them inside!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cornelius, if you have a moment today, I'd like to discuss this expedition of yours in more detail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He exits hurriedly. The Hunt Club Leader turns to Zaius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hunter guffaws. Zaius turns away and looks down at: 179
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (eagerly) Certainly, sir. I'll get my notes and come right over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand these animal psychologists. What's Dr. Zira trying to prove? ZAIUS That man can be domesticated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Just beyond the fence we can make out the letters:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius' extended foot appears beneath the bottom wire of the fence. The foot wipes out the letters. 180
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His face is a mask. 181
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is slumped against the bars of the cell, gingerly touching a large, reddening blotch on his arm. Julius watches him uncertainly from a few yards away . In the b.g., the outside door opens and Zira rushes in, hurries down the aisle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves to a cabinet at the other end of the laboratory, rummages through some drawers. 182
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those fools and their torches! Do you have any ointment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. Zira comes up to Taylor's cage, studies him solicitously.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Bright Eyes. 183
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He looks steadily at Zira, who is only an arm's length away. CAMERA MOVES IN on them. Suddenly Taylor reaches out, snatching the pen and notebook from the pocket of her smock. Zira leaps back with a cry. Julius grabs a club, races up to the cage, unlocks the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I told you what you'd get! 184
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TO INCLUDE THEM ALL Taylor is scribbling furiously on a sheet of note paper. The guard moves in, his club upraised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius swings his-club at Taylor's head. Taylor lifts his right arm to ward off the blow, and the stick strikes him sharply on the hand. He drops the pen and notebook. The guard swings again, driving Taylor to the wall. Then Julius retrieves the stolen articles. 185
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (pleading) Julius, don't. It doesn't matter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The guard returns her pen and notebook with the comment:
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Natural born thieves, aren't they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : A hasty, almost illegible scrawl:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes afire with a wild surmise. 188
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes never leave Taylor as she tells the guard:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guard shrugs and moves Off 0.3. Zira beckons to Taylor. He comes forward to the bars of the cage.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get me a collar and leash. I'm taking him to the infirmary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's vicious, Doctor. Besides, it's against the rules.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do as I say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto voce) You wouldn't hurt me, would you... Taylor? 189
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CORNELIUS' OFFICE - ESTABLISHING SHOT - DAY The office is simple, almost Spartan. There are books but no bric-a- brac; several painted portraits of Great Apes but no tape recorder or other modern office equipment. Taylor sits at a desk, scribbling furiously on a sheet of paper. His leash has been removed, but not his collar. Zira stands at his elbow. Cornelius paces nervously up and down, reading a sheaf of notes Taylor has already written.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (stubbornly) It's a stunt. Humans don't write.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dear, you're a scientist. Don't you believe your own eyes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Taylor) Where did you learn to do this? 190
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Taylor scribbles something on a small desk pad, rips off the page, hands it to Cornelius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at Taylor narrowly. Taylor nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor scribbles something else on the pad, hands it to Zira, points at Cornelius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles. Cornelius bristles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor has resumed writing. He hands the sheet to Zira, who reads aloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor writes quickly, hands the note to Zira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor impatiently begins to fold a sheet of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor points to the floor and mouths the word "Here." He flings the paper plane he has just fashioned into the air. It describes a graceful arc around the room and lands at the feet of Cornelius, who slowly picks it up, then exchanges a long glance with Zira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor scribbles on a piece of paper, hands it to Zira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius puts the paper plane on his desk, crosses to a wall map designed like a window shade. He pulls it down Taylor and Zira join him at the map. 191
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jefferson Public School, Fort Wayne, Indiana?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sardonically) Back on that planet you say you came from? (Taylor nods again) Um-hm. (to Zira) He may be intelligent, but he's also mad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reads aloud) 'And you're a fool'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, just a minute -- ZIRA Oh, Cornelius, be quiet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Dodge was killed in the hunt. What happened to Landon?' (looking at Taylor) I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (scornfully) And they fell out of the sky with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading) 'Not fell -- flew!'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Flight is a scientific impossibility.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And even if it weren't, why fly? Where would it get you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Well, now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading) 'Do you have maps?'
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's not a map of the whole planet, of course, but only of that portion known to the apes. Therefore it has the antique and fragmentary aspect of a map drawn by some Babylonian cartographer. A swatch of blue at the right margin indicates a sea. In the southwest quadrant are the "greenbelts" of the ape civilization, looking on the map like jade stones strung on crescent-shaped necklace. Rubyidots in the lade indicate ape communities. The northwest quadrant, colored brown, is apparently uninhabited. East of the green belts is a patch of green savanna, and next to it the darker green of a jungle. The eastern quadrants are rendered in yellow, and except for a blue lake, appear to be lifeless desert and barren mountain. This area is marked FORBIDDEN ZONE. Using a pointer, Cornelius orients Taylor, indicating a red dot in the middle of the green belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor studies the map, then pointing at the lake in the eastern desert, he goes into a brief charade, dramatizing the astronauts' landing and trek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor nods, smiles gratefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor slams his fist against the wall in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No creature can survive in that part of the Forbidden Zone. I've been there. I've seen it. 192
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We are here ... (moving pointer) You were captured about here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interpreting his movements) You fell in the water here? ... you came ashore ... you marched across the desert ... the mountains ... many days and nights ... and reached the jungle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flatly) Out - of - the - question!.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (annoyed) Cornelius, why do you insist on provoking him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (tapping map)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor touches Zira on the arm, makes a gesture of inquiry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor bangs his fist on the desk, mouths the word "No!" scribbles something on a piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor thrusts the sheet at Zira, who reads it aloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At that moment         there is a. loud RAP at the door o.s. All turn. 193
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (reading) 'Then how do you account for me?,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't. And I'm not going to try.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But what about your theory? The existence of someone like Taylor might prove it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shushing her) Zira, are you trying to get my head cut off?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be foolish. If it's true, they'll have to accept it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, they won't -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cornelius has developed a brilliant hypothesis -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quickly) It's probably wrong -- ZIRA -- that the ape evolved from a lower order of primate, possibly man. In his trip to the Forbidden Zone he discovered traces of a culture older than recorded time -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The evidence was very meager -- ZIRA You didn't think so then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was before Dr. Zaius and half the Academy said the idea was heresy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can scientific truth be heresy? What if Taylor is exactly the proof you needed? A mutation. A missing link between the unevolved primate and the ape -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's touchy, isn't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: am not a missing link.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because if he is a missing link, it means the Sacred Scrolls aren't worth their parchment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, maybe they're not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, thank you'. I won't get into that battle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Cornelius, show some strength!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zira, listen to me. We've got a fine future ahead of us. Marriage. Stimulating careers. I'm up for a raise --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dr. Zaius enters with another portly figure, DR. MAXIMUS. Like Zaius., Maximus is an orangutan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you forget our appointment, Cornelius?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Certainly, sir. It's a pleasure to see you again.

dialogue.raw_text: What is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A man, Dr. Maximus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Sir. But this -- creature is a special case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wouldn't it more properly be done in your office?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling) Guards?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius looks down at the paper plane in his hand, then back to Zira. He smiles tolerantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crumples the paper plane into a b all., drops it on the desk. The ape hooks the leash to Taylor's collar, starts leading him out. Zira follows them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A toy. It floats on the air. (faint defiance) Try it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a warning) Zira....
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nonsense.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The caged primitives are asleep. Julius, the keeper, dozes in a chair outside Taylor's cage. CAMERA PIVOTS MOVING IN ON Taylor, who is lying on his side, also asleep. Nova is curled up behind him. At the sound of a door opening, she comes instantly awake, sitting up and clutching Taylor's arm. He comes groggily awake, raising his head in time to hear:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) What's up, Lieutenant? 198
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: have just entered the compound. They wear side arms. Julius has just risen from his  chair.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue
