dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He stiffens but does not move. The apes, of course, speak freely in front of him, believing the animal cannot understand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Dr. Zira won't like it. She wants this pair to mate. 200
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. As the Lieutenant replies:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two gorillas exit. The guard crosses to a wall peg for a collar and 'Leash. 201
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: These orders came from Dr. Zaius himself. There's nothing she can do about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT - TAYLOR AND NOVA Pushing Nova aside, Taylor rises. 202
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Julius unlocks the door and cautiously approaches Taylor, carrying the collar and leash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The heel of Taylor's right palm crashes into the keeper's, chin, nearly snapping his neck. Julius falls unconscious. Taylor leans over him, taking his night stick and a set of keys on his belt. 203
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (murmuring) If only you knew, Bright Eyes, what they're going to do ... (raising collar) Stand still now...don't give me any trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The male has awakened. He stares stupidly at Taylor. Nova is whimpering, little strange cries of fear. Taylor moves o.s. 204
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leaves the cage, moves swiftly to the nearby door and exits. 205
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barefoot, Taylor silently pads down the corridor to a locked door. 206
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which is visible because of a beam of sunlight from the half-open door of a guard room. We HEAR a murmur of ape voices and LAUGHTER. Taylor fumbles with the keys, finds one that fits the lock and opens the door. 207
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He emerges, quietly locking the door behind him. Two tethered horses can be seen in deep b.g., and another gust of LAUGHTER can be heard from the nearby guard room. Taylor looks off. 208
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : As already established, the animal compound is situated on the outskirts of the apes' community. The strange skyline of the town can be seen in the distance. 209
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NING WITH TAYLOR He starts to cross an open field outside the compound. At that moment we HEAR a shrill police WHISTLE from the guard room. Taylor breaks into a run. 210
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the two gorilla officers emerge from the building and run toward their horses. 211
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He runs down the road, starts across the long causeway that bisects a small lake, looking over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The community we sue at the end of the causeway is small and arcane. There are no power lines, no street lamps -- indeed, no streets as such, but only a small cluster of buildings around a pleasant mall. The architecture of the buildings is faintly derivative of the simpler and less rococo work of Antonio Gaudi -- columns and pillars of brick or exterior masonry look like the trunks and branches of great trees and suggest an arboreal past. A small number of apes are visible on the mall: Taylor darts behind the buttress of a building, casing the situation. He looks back at: 213
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two mounted gorilla-police can be seen on the causeway, galloping straight toward CAMERA. It is evident they will soon spot Taylor. 214
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CLOSE SHOT He retreats from the buttress to a dark archway and vanishes inside the building. 215
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vestibule is nothing, no set required, a dark space through which Taylor moves toward a shaft of light. We HEAR faintly the discordant chords of an organ. Or is it an organ? At any rate,a strange and melancholy tune. Taylor arrives at a font. 216
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NING WITH TAYLOR He appears out of darkness into half-light. The rear of the temple is obscure. Taylor darts behind a screen. Crouching there, he observes: 217
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MED. LONG SHOT The temple itself is small and austere. There is no altar, but against a plain backdrop we see a statue of the Lawgiver, a Great Ape holding a book. Below the Lawgiver is an ORANGUTAN MINISTER clothed in black robes. He stands in front of a closed coffin. A dozen mourners, seated on comfortable wicker chairs, form a semi-circle around the coffin. The ape ladies wear cowls.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A FUNERAL CEREMONY IN THE TEMPLE

dialogue.raw_text: Weep if you must, but make an end of sorrow. He lives again. Yes, he has found peace in Heaven. 218
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Crouching, listening, wide-eyed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) He was a model for us all, a gorilla to remember; hunter, warrior, defender of the Faith. 219
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. As the minister continues his eulogy, a small ape boy detaches himself (as children will) from the group of mourners and comes marching up the aisle toward the rear of the temple.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cherished husband, beloved father, generous master -- yes, he was a font of simian kindness. 220
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Who is still crouching behind the screen in deep b.g. The small fry is coming closer. Over this we hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The small fry spots Taylor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mourners' heads turn. Taylor slinks toward the vestibule. 221
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) The dear departed once said to me:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: never met an ape I didn't like'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrill soprano) Look!. It's a man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He is aghast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two ushers rise, moving past CAMERA and o.s. 222
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In Heaven's name ... (aside to ushers) Get rid of that creature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Staying close on the temple wall, Taylor moves stealthily away from the vestibule door. The two ape ushers appear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There he is: They move toward Taylor. 223
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He runs out onto the mall. 224
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor belatedly sees that he is running straight toward his two mounted pursuers. Darting off in another direction, he races past startled pedestrians. 225
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They do a slow take.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You see what I saw?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Must've escaped from the zoo. 226
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He has spotted Taylor. Drawing a folded net from his saddlebag, he swings it overhead (like a cowboy with a lariat) and gallops off in pursuit of the man. 227-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S - TAYLOR AND PURSUING MOUNTIE 231 Taylor runs frantically from building to building, rounding corners, vanishing momentarily and reappearing on another part of the mall. At one point the mountie nearly overtakes him and flings his net, which falls short. Taylor runs on. 232
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOT (FROM GROUND LEVEL) It is an open-air structure, like a Greek theater, located near the central mail. Steeply tiered, it seats no more than fifty apes. The dais in the pit is some fifteen feet above ground level. Taylor enters scene, running toward the amphitheater. Changing direction, he darts into what appears to be an access tunnel. A moment later the pursuing cop rides into' scene, dismounts and walks toward the amphitheater, looking around for Taylor. 233
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOT (FROM TOPMOST TIER) Taylor suddenly emerges from the access tunnel and runs up a ramp encircling the amphitheater. (A retaining wall shields him from the view of the apes.) Pausing for breath at the top of the ramp, Taylor crouches behind the uppermost tier of seats and peers down:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. The cop looks around, spots Taylor at the top tier, and starts up after him. 235-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOP OF AMPHITHEATER - PANNING WITH TAYLOR He starts to run back down the ramp, but is suddenly confronted by his original pursuer (the dismounted cop coming up the ramp. Reversing direction, Taylor runs around the rim of the amphitheater and vanishes into an exit tunnel. The cop blows his whistle, summoning another cop, who joins him in the chase. 239-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A SWIFT SEQUENCE OF SHOTS 244 In which we see the fugitive, his pursuers and the reactions of ape shoppers and workers. 245-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S 248 A market has been set up on one side of the mall, where street vendors behind carts or tables hawk their wares: fruits, vegetables, wearing apparel, etc. As Taylor runs frantically through the market place, several apes join the chase. In the ensuing pandemonium, like the proverbial Chinese fire drill, several tables are overturned. 249
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor runs into scene, pauses, panting, and looks back at his pursuers. Then he darts through the archway into the building. 250
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the moment he is the sole visitor in this wing. His pace slows to a walk as he and we observe fleetingly the specimens in what is a simian museum: Possibly several stuffed and unfamiliar animals; primitive artifacts and fossils; possibly the skeleton of a dog, a cat, etc. Over this we hear a shrill police WHISTLE. 251
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He runs again. 252
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking at the stuffed animals as Taylor races past. The mother gives a startled SCREAM. 253
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts after the fugitive. 254
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FEATURING TAYLOR He runs past displays of other stuffed animals toward CAMERA and halts abruptly in close f.g., shocked by: 255
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stuffed and mounted, Dodge bares his teeth at the world. 256
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reacting in horror. He hears another police WHISTLE and the echoing FOOTSTEPS of approaching guards, which mufffle his strangled gasp:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor vanishes in a BLUR of movement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dodge ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Order has been restored in the open-air market. Taylor bursts suddenly into view from a building on the far side of the mall, running in panic from ape guards in close pursuit. A mounted policeman spots him and heads him off. Changing direction, Taylor is intercepted by another mounted Gorilla. And then a third.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the center of the mall. We are witnessing a hideous game: "baiting the man."  The mounted police do not shoot or club Taylor, for he cannot escape -- but they circle him, their long whips CRACKING over his head. 258
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE CIRCLE AROUND TAYLOR - FAVORING A MOUNTIE who unfolds his net, swings it overhead and flings it at Taylor. This time he bags his quarry. Taylor gives up. Spent, docile, entangled in the net, he stands stock-still in the center of the mall. Guards and civillians on foot join the circle around the man at bay. They regard him warily. 259
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ZIRA She pushes through the simian crowd around Taylor and hurries to his side. 260
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT - TAYLOR AND ZIRA She paws at the net, crying impulsively:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zira removes the net from his face. Panting with exhaustion, Taylor flicks a wild glance at her. He looks demented. 261
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Taylor, why'd you run away?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TO INCLUDE TWO GORILLA OFFICERS who approach Taylor and Zira. (They are the same gorillas introduced in Scene 198.) One of them carries a collar and leash. The other presents an I.D. card to Zira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His colleague moves toward Taylor with a muzzle. 262
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Security police.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (promptly) I'm in charge of this man. LIEUTENANT No longer, madame. He is now in the custody of the Ministry of Science.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He speaks at last, his voice hoarse but audible.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get away from me, you dirty ape! 263
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The arresting officer steps back involuntarily. All the apes freeze, staring at the speaking animal with mute astonishment as we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAGES - CLOSE SHOT - TAYLOR AND NOVA - DAY The compound is dimly lit. Taylor, the bandage now gone from his throat, is back in his old cage. The other cages, however, are empty -- their occupants presumably having been moved to the surgery or the zoo. He is seated on a pile of straw in the rear corner, Nova's head cradled on his lap. Idly he strokes her coarse hair. There is a dull glow of madness in his eyes, and his manner is one of abstract soliloquy, like a man talking to a dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His manner is now more direct, and educative., but she stares in blank comprehension. She brushes his moving lips with her fingers. He shrugs wryly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Faint footsteps are heard o.s. Taylor and Nova look in the direction of the sound. A sudden stream of water shoots through the bars and strikes Taylor in the chest. 265
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...and that's when I decided to take up astronautical engineering., you see. I was halfway through college and I... (he breaks off) It's an old trick! The silent treatment. Four weeks and three days, and not a word from anyone. Not Zira.,or Cornelius...or that damn Julius. No one'll listen... only you. You...Nova. NO-VAH.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah...me Tarzan, you Jane. That's all right ... I had a puppy once that never barked. He just licked my hand. (pause) He's dead now. They're all dead. Everything... I think maybe they'll kill me, too. Are they afraid of me? I can't hurt them... but I threaten them somehow. Threaten their faith in simian superiority. Yeah ... you're right. They'll have to kill me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - WHAT THEY SEE: An ape GUARD has a high pressure hose trained on Taylor. It forces him back toward the rear of the cage. Julius, whip in hand, unlocks the cage, steps inside. He unlimbers the whip., cracks it-'in Nova's direction. She recoils. The jet of water hold Taylor at bay. Julius grabs Nova, begins to pull her toward the door of the cage. Taylor tries to fight his way through the water toward Julius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius swings the whip. It cracks against Taylor's legs, biting into the skin. Taylor stumbles, falls to one knee
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius drags and pushes the girl through the door, slamming and locking it behind him. Taylor, fights through the stream of water, flings himself against the bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius shoves Nova across the aisle to a cage opposite Taylor's, locks her inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius gestures toward the ape guard
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ape guard shuts off the hose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius strides over to Taylor's cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slashes viciously with his whip handle against Taylor's fingers. Taylor yells in pain. Julius and the ape guard start out of the compound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sinks to the floor as the apes go out. 266
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let her alone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you taking her? What are you going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (raging) Take your hands off her, you black monster! You filth!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are you doing this? Say something, you hairy scum!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Turn it off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answer me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fiercely) Shut up! The reason no one'll talk to you is because you're a freak!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Dr. Zira? Why--?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said shut up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wildly) Ape! Apes wearing clothes! It's a madhouse! A madhouse!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Taylor looks desolately through the bars across to Nova's cage. She eyes him sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at Nova. She stretches her hands through the bars toward him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (gently) Now I don't even have you. (pause) Imagine me -- needing someone. Back on Earth there was nobody. Women, yes. Lots of them. Love making  ithout love. That's the kind of world it was turning into, with the help of cynics like myself. So I left it -- because there was no one dear enough to keep me there. (pause) Did I tell you about Stewart? (Looking away) There was a lovely girl. The most precious cargo we brought along. If human life could survive here, she was to be the new Eve. (morosely) It's probably just as well she didn't live to see this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wonder if it's Love between us. (looks around, smiles ironically) What a place to find it. C-267
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two gorilla officers enter, carrying torches. (These are the same apes introduced in Scene 198.) One carries a double set of manacles. Julius comes to meet them. The Lieutenant takes the two sets of manacles from the other officer, hands them to Julius, whispers something. Julius comes over and unlocks the door of Taylor's cage. He advances to Taylor, who does not move, bends down and clamps the manacles around each of his ankles. Then he straightens, lifts Taylor's arms, pulls his wrists together, snaps on the cuffs. D-267
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE CAGE Taylor looks across at Nova, blows her a kiss. Julius leads him out of the cage, takes his leash from a snaps it onto Taylor's collar, hands the other end to the Lieutenant. Nova and Julius watch in silence as Taylor is led down the aisle and out the door. 268-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor, wearing his manacles, is seated at a table in the otherwise deserted chamber. There is an empty chair on either side of him. Across the room stands a dais with three rude, high-backed chairs. There is a small table directly below the dais. A third table stands at right angles to the dais. Taylor looks around the empty room. A door is opened by a gorilla BAILIFF, and Zira and Cornelius come into the room, sit down on each side of Taylor. A moment later, DR.HONORIUS, the Prosecutor and a CLERK enter, take their seats at the third table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All rise! Everyone gets up as THE PRESIDENT, Dr. Zaius and Dr. Maximus enter and mount the dais. The President takes the center chair; the other two flanking him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honorius rises and bows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The President appears to be taken aback. He glances at his colleagues.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Where have you been? Why didn't you come to see me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shhhh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A hearing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hissing) Be clever. Be quiet,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be seated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pounds gavel once) This ad hoc Tribunal of the National Academy is now in session. President of the Academy presiding. On my right, Dr. Maximus, Commissioner for Animal Affairs. On my left, Dr. Zaius, Minister of Science and Chief Defender of the Faith... (glancing at Prosecutor) Appearing for the State, Dr. Honorius, Deputy Minister of Justice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (raps gavel once) Let it be clear at the outset that all matters pertaining to this inquiry are confidential, and anyone discussing them outside this chamber will be held in contempt of the Tribunal. (a beat) You may proceed, Dr. Honorius.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) By your leave, Mr. President -- the Tribunal has not yet defined the purpose of this inquiry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You asked for the opportunity to present your case. Surely you must know why you're here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My own purpose is to save this exceptional creature from mutilation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (promptly) And our purpose is to settle custodial and jurisdictional questions concerning this beast, and determine what's to be done with him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At the very least, this man has the right to know whether there's a charge against him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) Objection. The accused is indeed a man. Therefore, he has no rights under ape law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, Dr. Zira? This is a man, is he not? 274
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: GROUP SHOT - THE DEFENDANT'S TABLE Sensing that the President has given them an opening, Zira smiles confidently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir? The question is the point at issue: Is he a man? Or a deviate? Or a freak of nature?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He is unlike any man you have ever seen - as we hope to prove.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Answer the question. Is he a man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (tentatively)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Objection! 275
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the Prosecutor continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why is he called the accused Your Honors must think him guilty of something. Honorius seems confounded. Zaius takes over.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sustained. In all fairness, Dr. Zira, you must admit the accused is a nonape, and therefore has no rights under ape law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This man is not being tried. He is being disposed of. (pointing at Zira and Cornelius) It is scientific heresy that is actually on trial here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well put, Dr. Zaius. Let us warn our friends that they endanger their own careers by defending this animal. 276
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Both Cornelius and Zira appear shaken by this threat. Sensing their predicament, Taylor rises impatiently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then I'll defend myself. 277
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Although the judges and Prosecutor have been told that this man can speak, they react in stunned silence to the first sound of his voice. Flustered, the President bangs his gavel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The President refuses to address Taylor directly. Checking a document, he speaks to Zira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bailiff quickly crosses to Taylor and shoves him roughly into his chair.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Zira -- tell Bright Eyes to sit down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My name is Taylor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It says here that his name is Bright Eyes. You gave him that name yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice rising) This hearing is absurd! Let me tell my story...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pounds gavel) Bailiff! Make the animal be quiet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: State your case, Mr. Prosecutor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Learned Judges: My case is simple. It is based on our first Article of Faith: that the Almighty created the ape in his own image; that He gave him a soul and a mind; that He set him apart from the beasts of the jungle, and made him the lord of the planet. 278
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: GROUP SHOT - THE DEFENDANT'S TABLE Taylor has begun to write something on a sheet of paper. Zira and Cornelius remain attentive to:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) These sacred truths are self-evident. The proper study of apes is apes. But certain young cynics have chosen to study man - yes, perverted scientists who advance on insidious theory called 'evolution.' 279
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the Prosecutor continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can reason? With the Tribunal's permission, let me expose this hoax by direct examination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Proceed. But don't turn this hearing into a farce. Honorius crosses to the defendant's table and favors Taylor with an evil smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zira moves toward the dais. Honorius returns to his own table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zira crosses to the dais, handing the statement to the President. He glances at it, laughs derisively and passes it to Zaius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Returning to her table, Zira gestures to Taylor to remain silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: correction -- my exhibits are on display in the amphitheater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The President rises, starts out, followed by the others. Taylor is last, being led on a leash by the bailiff. 280
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There is a conspiracy afoot to undermine the very cornerstone of our Faith
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come to the point, Dr. Honorius.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Directly, Mr. President. This wretched man, the accused, is only a pawn in the conspiracy. We know that he was wounded in the throat at the time of his capture. The State charges that Dr. Zira and a corrupt surgeon named Galen experimented on this wounded animal, tampering with his brain and throat tissues to create a speaking monster ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on her feet) ThatOs a lie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pounding gavel) Mind your tongue, madame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did we create his mind too? Not only can this man speak. He can write. He can reason.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the court, Bright Eyes -- what is the second Article of Faith?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I admit, I know nothing of your culture.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course he doesn't know our culture - because he cannot think. (to Taylor) Tell us why all apes are created equal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some apes, it seems, are more equal than others.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ridiculous. That answer is a contradiction in terms. Tell us, Bright Eyes, why do men have no souls? What is the proof that a divine spark exists in the simian brain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hands paper to Zira) Show this to the President.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Since the defendant is forbidden to speak in his own defense, he asks that this statement be read into the record.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Read it yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading aloud) 'I have come to you from a planet in a different solar system. I am an explorer in space, with no hostile intentions against your civilization. On my planet it was the primate Man who evolved Into a thinking animal, while the apes remained..."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rapping gavel) Stop right there. Bring me that paper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Zira) This is a joke in very poor taste.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it a joke to seek the truth about this man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (glancing at document) Dr. Zira -- you state here that a ship from outer space sank in an inland sea of our eastern desert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not state it, sir. The prisoner does.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you believe him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uneasily) Like you, I find it difficult.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But how convenient that the proof of his arrival has vanished? (glancing again at document) You also state that Bright Eyes had two intelligent companions at the time of his capture.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is his assertion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are they now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blurting it out) One is in a museum!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pounding gavel) Dr. Zira! Silence that man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How sad. Stuffed and mounted, eh? Dead men, like sunken ships, can tell no stories. And his other companion?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He doesn't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. President, I believe the Prosecutor has reassembled all he surviving humans captured in the hunt along with Bright Eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's true, Dr. Zaius. My witnesses --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well. I suggest we go and look at them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . AMPHITHEATER - FULL SHOT - DAY The inquiry group files through a door into the amphitheater. Two APES stand guard over a number of leashed and nearly naked human beings in the center of the pit below the dais. There are three primitive males, the female Nova -- and Landon. He is dirty and bearded, but his hair is cropped close. 282
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Zira, his eyes shining with vindication.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (a whisper) It's him...Landon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Second from the left. 283
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Zaius glances at the accused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor moves forward for a few paces, stops.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well...do you acknowledge kinship with any of these creatures?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With one of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Identify him, then. Speak to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Landon? 284
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM TAYLOR'S P.O.V. Landon looks catatonic. His face is in shadow 285
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TO INCLUDE TAYLOR Stunned by Landon's imbecility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor steps forward to grasp his arm. There is still no response. Taylor takes Landon's head in his hands and looks at his face. There is a fresh scar running from his forehead to the top of his cranium. 286
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: John ... it's me, Taylor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Taylor whirls on Zira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bailiff Jerks brutally on Taylor's leash, pulling him toward the door leading under the amphitheater. A-286
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You! ... You knew about this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I swear -- I never saw this man before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whirling on Zaius) You did this to him! You've removed his frontal lobes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Silence! (turning) Bailiff, take the prisoner inside!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The bailiff enters, dragging Taylor behind him, shoves him into his chair. Moments later the other apes enter the room. All take their seats but Zaius. Taylor glares at him furiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor leaps from his chair, livid with rage, approaches the dais.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bailiff and a husky guard seize Taylor, who continues shouting:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The powerful guard twists Taylor's arms behind his back and the bailiff lashes his wrists together. Then the bailiff gags Taylor. His voice is cut off as the bailiff ties the twisted kerchief around his open mouth. The guard holds Taylor's leash during the rest of this scene. Meanwhile, Cornelius has risen to his feet. His tone is firm, but conciliatory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let them talk, Mr President. Let them talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius has regained his courage. Rising to Zira's support, he points at Taylor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (promptly) Yes, sir. The State charges Doctors Zira and Cornelius with contempt of this Tribunal, malicious mischief and scientific heresy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All rise. The guard drags Taylor from the inquiry room. Zira and Cornelius stand there, stunned by the entrapment into which Zaius has maneuvered them. 287- 289
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) Mr. President, a word of explanation: the creature in question suffered a skull fracture during the hunt. Two fine veternary surgeons under my direction were able to save his life. But the beast could not speak, of course. Nor will he ever speak
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You destroyed his memory! His mind! His identity! And, you want to do the same to me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pounding gavel) Bailiff! Stop this outburst! Gag that monstrosity!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You barbarians!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May it please the Tribunal: I for one grant that this being cannot have come from another planet. But this much is certain -- he comes from somewhere in the Forbidden Zone. He has described the region to us, and described it accurately, for I have been there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You visited the Forbidden Zone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why, yes, sir. A year ago. With the special permission of the Academy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to President) He exceeded his orders. His travel permit was promptly revoked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir, so it was -- thanks to you. But not before I discovered evidence of a simian culture that existed long before the Sacred Scrolls were written ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Objection! These remarks are profane and irrelevant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sustained. (to Cornelius) Your archeological theories have no bearing on the disposition of this creature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) Sirs: our theories have a bearing on his identity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let us assume, as common sense dictates, that the prisoner's story is false. But if he does not come from another planet, then surely he sprang from our own. Yes, sprang. (a beat) As an animal psychologist, I have found no physiological defect to explain why humans are mute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Objection!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sustained.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (plunging on) Their speech organs are adequate. The flaw lies not in anatomy but in the brain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Objection!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sustained.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice rising) Sustain all objections, but face the truth!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes! Behold this marvel, this living paradox, this missing link in an evolutionary chain!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pounding gavel) Silence! (Puffing with rage) You have gone too far.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) There you are, Mr. President. I warned you these two would use this hearing as a forum for subversion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were right! The advocates of heresy have revealed themselves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. President, I think an indictment is in order.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be it so ordered. The Tribunal will examine all the evidence presented here and in due time render a verdict on the proposed indictment and on the disposition of the deviate in question. (pounds gavel once) This hearing is adjourned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ZAIUS - NIGHT The office is as unadorned and Spartan as that of Cornelius  -- in fact, with minor changes in decor, the same set can be used. There are many thick leatherbound books on this scholar's desk. Zaius is reading one of them and taking notes. He looks up as someone KNOCKS at the door. 291
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two agents push Taylor through the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The officers withdraw, closing the door. Collared, wrists manacled, Taylor stands facing the desk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Wait outside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The verdict is in. At the moment your simian friends -- and  sponsors -- are free on bail. But they'll soon be brought to trial for heresy. 292
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: who falls silent, as if this were the only news of import. We note at once a change In Zaius' tone and attitude. He no longer treats Taylor like a freak animal, but addresses him as an imaginative adversary who must be intimidated by the threat of terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor stiffens but says nothing. Zaius lets this prospect sink in, then continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told the truth at that 'hearing'of yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a mutant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two burly security agents open the door and enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guards seize Taylor, start to shove him toward the doorway. He twists around, faces Zaius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius jerks his head silently toward the door. The apes drag Taylor through it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What about me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (offhandedly) Oh, your case was preordained. In a way, you performed a service for the State ... (smiling) Because your hearing made it possible for us to expose Zira and Cornelius. (a beat) And now the Tribunal has placed you in my custody for...final disposition. Do you know what that means?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Emasculation, to begin with. Then experimental surgery. On the speech centers. On the brain. Ultimately, a kind of living death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: However, it's within my power to grant You a reprieve.  That is why I summoned you here tonight. (a beat) Tell me who and what you really are and where you come from, and no veterinary will touch you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lied. Where is your tribe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My tribe, as you call it, lives on another planet in a distant solar system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then how is it we speak the same language? (suddenly intense) Even in your lies, some truth slips through! That mythical community you're supposed to come from -- Fort Wayne'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A fort! Unconsciously, you chose a name that was belligerent. (more calmly) Where were you nurtured?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I take it you don't believe the prosecutor's charge -- that I'm a monster created by Dr. Zira.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Certainly not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's exactly what Zira and Cornelius claim. You're talking heresy, doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (growing bolder) All right, suppose I am a mutant? Why does the appearance of one mutant send you into a panic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you're not unique. There was the one you call Landon -- TAYLOR Then you admit -- ZAIUS I admit that where there's one mutant there's probably another. And another. A nest of them. Where's your nest, Taylor? Where are your women?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pause) Thank you for calling me Taylor. (more firmly) Dr. Zaius, I know who I am. Who are you? How did this upside down civilization ever get started?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (strangely calm) You may well call it upside down, since you occupy its lowest level. And deservedly. (pause) The eastern desert has never been explored -- because we've always assumed that no life can exist there. (a beat) Save yourself, Taylor. Tell me -- is there another jungle beyond the Forbidden Zone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you are protecting others of your kind, it will cost you your identity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not protecting anybody! That hearing was a farce. What have I done?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a menace! A walking pestilence. I do know who you are, Taylor. As I know that others of your kind must live in the Forbidden Zone. (decisively) You have just six hours to make a full confession. After that I'll employ surgery to obtain one. (calling off) Guards!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take this creature back to his cage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, you can cut me to pieces. It's within your power. (with force) But know this, doctor. You do it because you're afraid of me. You do it from fear!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A few hours have passed. Nova is watching Taylor from her cage across the aisle. He sits on the pile of straw. There is an ugly welt on his cheek made by the security officer's whip. FOOTSTEPS are heard. Taylor and Nova look up and off. 294
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A solemn, teen-age chimp named LUCIUS appears outside the cage. The guard Julius rises from his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor enters scene, coming over to the cage bars as Lucius continues gravely, with just a note of disdain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop making speeches and show me the order. Lucius hands the guard a document. It is dark here, so Julius crosses to a beam of light near the bars and studies the document. Lucius, behind the guard's back, signals frantically for Taylor to seize or strike the guard. Taylor is slow to understand. Lucius shakes his head impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucius suddenly gives Julius a violent shove. The guard's head crashes against the bars and he is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor complies  bringing down the heel of his fist on the nape of the guard's neck. Julius collapses. The youngster immediately squats down, gags him, and begins to bind him hand and foot. CAMERA MOVES IN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taking the guard's keys, Lucius rises and unlocks the cage. Nova enters the scene, coming to the bars of her cage. 295
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you Julius?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm from the Office of Animal Affairs. (indicating Taylor) This male's to be transferred to the zoo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At this hour? Who says so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't they tell you anything? The Anti- vivisectionist Society is up in arms. They're going to save this beast from those butchers in the lab. If he can speak he belongs in the public zoo. (taking off) But what'll probably happen is that some money-mad grown-up will put him in a circus. And then we'll have to pay to see what rightfully should have -- JULIUS
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (peering at document) This order's no good. It must be counter- signed by Dr. Zaius --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hit him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking up,coolly) So you can talk. (as he works) I'm Dr. Zira's nephew. This abduction was her idea. You're not really going to the zoo. That's just our cover story in case we're stopped. (off again) Although I do feel that if it ever came down to a question of whether something like you should be public or private property -- TAYLOR Come on. Get me out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT - TAYLOR AND NOVA He gazes at her, tense with indecision. She flashes an imploring smile, a mute appeal that cannot be denied. Over this we hear:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) We've got to move fast. 296
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TO INCLUDE LUCIUS as Taylor leaves his cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucius unlocks Nova's cage. She comes out quickly, takes Taylor's hand. They follow Lucius out of the compound. 297
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She comes along too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zira doesn't want your female.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a shrug) If you insist. But I'm not taking any orders -- TAYLOR Fine. Just let her out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A horse-drawn caged wagon (like that used in the hunt) stands near the building. Zira waits at the rear of the wagon. Lucius, Taylor and Nova emerge from a doorway or archway and join her. Zira notes Nova's presence with disapproval. They speak in undertones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor and Nova comply, climbing into the cage. Lucius closes the tailgate. Lucius and Zira move to the front of the wagon and climb aboard. Lucius takes the reins. As they move off:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Lucius) I told you not to bring the other one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He wouldn't leave her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a sigh) All right... (to the humans) Get in...hurry.  Put this on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Taylor -- just keep quiet and we may get away with this. Remember that men all look alike to most apes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: SHOT - NIGHT As previously established, the animal compound is on the outskirts of Apetown. The abductors must cross the causeway on their route of escape. In the distance, near the gazebo, we can see the lights of several torches. The caged wagon rolls into scene and out onto the causeway. At the same time a mounted gorilla leading two pack animals appears on the far side of the causeway, coming toward CAMERA. Lucius stops the wagon. 299
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT - LUCIUS AND ZIRA - ON THE WAGON LUCIUS (apprehensively) Gorilla hunters ...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Keep moving. We can't turn back now. 300
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the mounted hunter nears the wagon, we can see two bodies slung across the backs of the pack animals. 301
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - IN WAGON CAGE They look out at: 302
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FROM THEIR P.O.V. The bodies on the horses are naked human corpses. 303
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT - THE CAUSEWAY - REVERSE ANGLE In immediate f.g., near the gazebo, is a similar wagon. It has lost a wheel, and its rear axle lies on the edge of the causeway. Two naked primitive males can be dimly seen within the cage. Four or five armed gorilla hunters stand near the wagon: two of them carry torches; the others are passing a jug from hand to hand-. The leader of the Hunt Club, still on horseback, holds up his hand as the lab wagon approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucius obeys. The hunters on foot swarm around his wagon as their leader calls authoritatively:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hold it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, Doctor Zira! Our wagon broke down! I'm afraid we'll have to commandeer yours. 304
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE LAB WAGON as the Hunt Club Leader rides over, recognizing the animal psychologist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves to the rear of the wagon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucius jumps down and runs toward the rear of the wagon. 305
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You can't! I've two sick humans in the cage. We're taking them to the chief vet at the zoo ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating his own wagon) We bagged two live ones today. I'll have to ask you to take them along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (following him; frantically) No, no, my animals are diseased... Leave them alone! They're diseased, I tell you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The hunters have opened the tailgate and are shining their torches on the humans. They sound ready for sport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the hunters points his torch at Taylor, who, quite naturally, shrinks back as Lucius runs into scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hunters fall back. Lucius promptly locks the tailgate and he and Zira run back to the front of the wagon. Lucius snaps the reins and the wagon moves off. The hunters follow it a few paces, pausing near their mounted leader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fugitives' wagon recedes beyond the gazebo, as we:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Give him a taste of fire!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stand back! He's dangerous!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's rabid! His bite is fatal!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You serious?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You would die in agony! (with appropriate gestures) Frothing at the mouth!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They treat those animals better than they treat us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I still say the only good human is a dead human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The horse-drawn wagon is silhouetted-against the dawn light, bumping across a semi-arid plain studded with mesquite and sage. (This SCENE can be SHOT either on the Navajo reservation near Page or on the Ranch).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the same area described on page 24, where the hunt occurred. As the wagon rolls along a dirt track, the tall grasses of the savanna (or cultivated field) can be seen in b.g. 308
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT - TAYLOR AND NOVA - IN WAGON CAGE Taylor is dozing, but the girl is alert and nervous. She peers out at the field, apparently recognizing or remembering this terrain. She nudges Taylor, waking him. 309
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This, too, is the location described on page 24. CAMERA PANS with the wagon as it rolls into the grove and HOLDS on three horses. Cornelius sits astride one horse; the other two nags are heavily burdened with packs and saddlebags. 310
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE GROVE - FAVORING CORNELIUS He dismounts as Zira and Lucius jump down from the wagon and hurry toward him. Cornelius and his fiancee embrace and kiss lightly, ape-fashion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How did it go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was one bad moment -- some hunters stopped us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) I pursuaded them our beasts had rabies. 311
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT - TAYLOR AND NOVA - IN CAGED WAGON The apes discussing the abduction are out of earshot. Exasperated to be thus ignored and caged, Taylor kicks the tailgate, shouting:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let me out of here! 312
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TO INCLUDE THE GROUP Lucius hurries back to unlock the tailgate. Taylor gets out of the wagon, stretching his stiffened joints. Nova follows suit. During the ensuing exchange the girl seems strangely agitated, pacing to and fro, her eyes scanning the grove and fields in search of someone or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves toward one of the horses. Cornelius starts after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor takes a rifle from one of the packs, examines it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zira and Lucius have come up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you wish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the diggings I worked at a year ago. It's a three day ride across the eastern desert, near where you claim you landed from that planet of yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor makes a helpless gesture, realizing that he cannot present sure proof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nova seizes Taylor's arm to get his attention. Trying to communicate, she makes whimpering sounds and points at: 313- 314
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (approaching) Well, Taylor -- we're all fugitives now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have any weapons?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The best. But we won't need them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just the same, I want one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look here, Taylor. I'm in charge of this expedition --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fair enough. But you're no longer in charge of me. And I don't mean to be captured again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (peeved)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zaius seems to think there might be another jungle beyond the Forbidden Zone. That's what  we'll try for. What about you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cornelius and I have been indicted for heresy. Unless we can prove our theories, we don't stand a chance of acquittal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going back to the Forbidden Zone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You still don't believe me, do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs) It's a long detour to Dead Lake. What would we find?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing much. The remnants of a life raft. Maybe a small flag. The emblem of my countrymen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, Taylor. The terrain around that lake is poisonous. There is no fresh water, no vegetation. Nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know ... Nevertheless, I thank you for saving us. You'll be in trouble for going there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a smile) We've been in trouble since the moment we met you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - AS SEEN FROM THE GROVE This is the same view of the jungle that Taylor saw when the gorilla hunters emerged from the trees. (Page 25)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) What's she pointing at? 316
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Taylor smiles at Nova, gives her a reassuring shrug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nova turns away, still holding Taylor's arm, tries to lead him toward the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she turns; he shakes his head, says gently) We can't stay there. It's not safe. She looks at him sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's put the water and provisions in the wagon. He and Lucius move off toward the horses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks off to help Lucius and Cornelius. Nova tags along behind him as we:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BACK TO TAYLOR AND THE OTHERS

dialogue.raw_text: That's the way home. And she knows it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) Nova!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'd better get started. If the mounted police pick up our trail, they'll come this far at least.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. (to Lucius)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating Nova) Are you going to take her with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, you're a different breed. This creature will never evolve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) You want her that much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (testily) You threw us together, remember? And you guessed right. Men, like apes, get despondent without a mate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: THE GROUP MOVES ACROSS A PLATEAU DISSOLVE TO

direction.raw_text: The caravan is crossing, in a reverse direction, the route taken by the astronauts on page 17. The three apes are on horseback. Taylor and Nova follow in the wagon. They are nearing the row of sinister scarecrows on the bluff above the dry wash. 318
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They halt briefly and look up at the crosses. Lucius is impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move off again, riding across the dry wash. 319
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who put them up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Hunt Club.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To scare off humans?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To scare us, too. We're entering the Forbidden Zone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - SEATED ON THE WAGON They, too, have stopped and are looking up at the scarecrows. Nova is plainly terrified. She grabs Taylor's arm, whimpers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands the reins to Nova. She just sits there. He demonstrates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nova flicks the reins, reacting in wide-eyed, open-mouthed disbelief as the horse obeys her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry. You'll be safe with me. (sudden smile) Here. It's time you learned to earn your keep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can do it. Like this ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: SHOT - DAY FOR NIGHT The party is traversing a red desert to the east of Dead Lake. Great sandstone monoliths rise from the desert floor. From this vantage point the horses look no bigger than ants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is terrain never before seen in this picture. (Lake Powell location, a few miles northeast of Wahweap). The party can be seen on the rim of a flat desert tableland that falls away abruptly to a vast, irregular river of deep blue water. Taylor, Cornelius and Lucius are unloading the wagon and repacking their provisions and equipment on the backs of horses. Zira watches them. A-321
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE GROUP Zira wanders off, falls to her knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor looks off. He and the others move quickly to Nova, CAMERA PANNING with them. B-321
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Something's wrong with your mate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: GROUP SHOT - AROUND NOVA She has been retching. Taylor lifts her up. She is faint with nausea. Zira squats down beside them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assisting Nova to her feet, Zira leads her off toward the wagon. C-321
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let me handle this. (ruefully, to Taylor) You may be smarter than I am, but I'm the veterinary on this planet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Taylor watches the departing females, then looks down at the river.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where does the river lead?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It empties into a sea some miles from here. That's where the cave is. D-321
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM THEIR P.O.V.. The river winds o.s. between the sheer sandstone Cliffs rising from either bank.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) And beyond that? E-321
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Don't know. At high tide you can't ride along the shore, and we had no boats on the last expedition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They start toward the horses and wagon. F-321
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You've never told me why this region's called the Forbidden Zone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one really knows. It's an ancient taboo. Set forth in the Sacred Scrolls. The Lawgiver pronounced the area deadly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shouldn't we be moving on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm for that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Zira is looking curiously at Nova, who stands in the shade leaning against the wagon as the males enter the scene. Nova's nausea has passed, and she comes smiling to Taylor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's the diagnosis, doctor? A touch of the sun?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's not sick at all. (a beat) She's pregnant. G-321
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Consternation slowly gives way to wonder. He grins.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So I'm not an altogether different breed, you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - SEVERAL SHOTS - DAY To reach the camp site -- a beach at the base of the gorge -- the party must lead the horses along a narrow trail that zigzags down the face of the sandstone cliffs. They have abandoned the wagon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sand bars and two narrow beaches are in evidence here. The camp itself consists of several lean-tos against the cliff wall. Above the camp, reached by ladders connected to scaffolding, is the mouth of a cave. Zira is cleaning up the breakfast things; Zaius and Lucius are sorting out equipment. A-326
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TAYLOR AND ZIRA A small bowl of water rests on the ground in front of Taylor He has nearly finished shaving himself with a sharp hunting knife. Nova watches, a look of fascinated approval on her face. Taylor rinses off his knife, starts to dry it. Nova reaches out, gently strokes his smooth -- if nicked -- chin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucius and Cornelius come up, Zira with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor grins wryly at Cornelius, picks up his rifle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) You like it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disapprovingly) Why did you do that? Scrape off your hair?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In my world -- before I left it - only youngsters of your age wore un- scraped hair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Taylor, quizzically) It makes you look somehow ... less intelligent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When are you going to show me what's in the cave?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right now, if you like.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop right there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be a fool. You're outnumbered and outgunned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If there's any shooting, Dr. Zaius, you'll be the first to die. Depend on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (protesting) Taylor, you're not in command here. Put down that gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well. (to his followers) Lower your weapons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) Tell them to move around the point. Out of range.

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE GROUP As Zaius draws nearer) Lucius lowers his rifle. But Taylor keeps his at the ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius laughs derisively, then turns to the apes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor, please -- TAYLOR Except that he's also the Chief Defender of the Faith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gestures toward the path leading to it. Zaius, Zira, and Cornelius start upward. Lucius starts to follow them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pats the barrel of Lucius' gun, in the manner of a stern but benevolent non-com, then starts up the trail with Nova at his heels. Lucius, unused to taking commands from an animal, scowls after him, then shrugs, adjusting to the Idea. 352- 355
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (uncertainly) How did you know we'd come here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't difficult. Only an apostate or a lunatic would flee to the Forbidden Zone. (a glance at Taylor) I see you brought along the female of your species. (Taylor nods) I didn't realize a man could be monogamous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On this planet -- it's easy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (evenly) I ask you to reconsider the rash course you've taken. If you're convicted of heresy, the most you'll get is two years. But if you persist in pointing guns in my direction, you'll hang for high treason.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (respectfully) We've never meant to be treasonable, sir. (pointing off) But up there, in the face of that Cliff, is a vast cave -- and in that cave a fabulous treasure of fossils and artifacts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've seen some of your fossils and artifacts. They're worthless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (derisively) And that's your Minister of Science. Honor- bound to expand the frontiers of knowledge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (worried)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (loftily) There is no contradiction between faith and science. True science.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suddenly angered) All right, let's see if you're willing to put that statement to a test.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Taylor, I'd rather you -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. You saved me from this fanatic. Maybe I can pay you back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) What is your proposal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When were the Sacred Scrolls written?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twelve hundred years ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well. If Zira and Cornelius can prove that those scrolls don't tell the whole truth of your history; if they can show you definite evidence of another culture from an unrecorded past -- will you exonerate them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.Up to the cave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, Lucius. You'll have to stay here and guard the horses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Always giving orders. Just like every other adult.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Relax. You'll see it all later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . WESTERN WALL OF GORGE - LONG SHOT - ANGLING UP AFTERNOON The sun hovers over the lofty rim of the lake like a great red balloon. The wall of the gorge, in shadow, is a darker hue. 357
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crenelated east wall, looking like a red cathedral, is aglow with sunlight. So is the mouth of the cave as the three apes, Taylor and Nova pass through it and o.s. 358
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nature has formed a vaulted room here. It need not be enormous, but should be as weird and fantastic as production capabilities permit. There is an ape-made excavation in the floor of the cave, some ten feet square and eight feet deep. Some small objects lie on the rim of the excavation. Zaius, Cornelius, Zira, Taylor and Nova enter from the outside. (AUTHOR'S NOTE: The effect should be an eyeful. I wish to create an illusion of sunlight penetrating this cave, flooding it with direct, refracted illumination, transforming it into a kaleidoscopic cavern.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius clambers down into the pit, followed by Zira. Taylor bends down, examines some of the artifacts lined along the edge of the excavation. Nova sits beside him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Present your evidence, Cornelius.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) It was at this level I discovered traces of an early ape creature -- stage of primitive barbarism, really -- dating back roughly thirteen hundred years. It was here I found cutting tools and arrowheads of quartz and the fossilized bones of carnivorous gorillas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MOVES IN SLOWLY as Cornelius continues:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But the artifacts lying at your feet were found here, at this level. And that's the paradox. The more ancient culture is the more advanced. Admittedly, many of these objects are unidentified, but clearly they were fashioned by beings with a knowledge of metallurgy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: IN on the group in and around the excavation as Cornelius continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius flicks a hostile glance at Taylor, then looks down at the artifacts. He nudges them with his foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius deigns to stoop and pick it up. 359
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Indeed, the very fact that these tools are unknown to us could suggest a culture in certain ways almost equal to our own. Some of the evidence is uncontestable ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Don't speak to me in absolutes. The evidence is contestable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I apologize.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To begin with, your methods of dating the past are crude, to say the least. There are geologists on my staff who would laugh at your speculations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps that's why they're on your staff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Secondly, if these 'tools' as you call them, are unidentified, why are they introduced as 'evidence' of anything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (promptly) But there's the doll, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) Right there. The human doll.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - IN ZAIUS' HAND It is only a porcelain fragment, but the head is intact, and it is unmistakably the form of a human child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does this prove? My grand- daughter plays with human dolls. 360
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INCLUDING TAYLOR Exasperated, Zira turns to the man for confirmation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius idly tosses the doll to the ground near Nova. She picks it up, studies it. 361
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Taylor! Tell him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He has a point. On my planet children often play with ape dolls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cornelius tries again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until the Lawgiver proved that man could not be tamed. Keep digging Cornelius. You'll find evidence of the master of this house: an ape.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A doll alone proves nothing. True. But the doll was found beside the jawbone of a man -- and no trace of simian fossils has turned up in this deposit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your conclusion is premature. Have you forgotten your Scripture? The Thirteenth Scroll? (quoting from memory) 'And Proteus brought the upright beast into the garden, and chained him to a tree, and the children made sport of him.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatiently) No sir, I haven't forgotten.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well? For a time the ancients kept humans as household pets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Zira again appeals to the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor, who has been toying with objects in the dirt, looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius and Zira cross the pit and Zaius walks around the rim of the excavation. B-361
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you going to let that pass without an answer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I have to agree. From all you've found so far, his position's as good as yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (annoyed) What are you doing there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Reconstructing a life. Care to have a look?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Taylor pauses. Zaius picks up two of the steel rings, studies them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Cornelius) These were found near the human doll, right? (Cornelius nods) Well, whoever owned them was in pretty bad shape.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Defective eyesight..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He wore false teeth. (pause) He suffered from a hernia and used this truss to hold up his insides ... (pause) And toward the end, these little rings of stainless steel enclosed a prefab- ricated valve in his failing heart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't say he was a man like an Earthman, but I'd call him a close relative, for he was plagued by most of man's ills. (to Zaius pointedly) Yet, fragile as he was, he came before you -- and was superior to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a calm smile) That's lunacy. I can give an alternate description for everyone of those objects that's equally as inventive as yours. But it would be conjecture, not proof. 362
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mamma! Mamma! Mamma!.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Zaius! Would an ape make a human doll that talks?

dialogue.raw_text: You louse!

direction.name: direction

CAMERA PULLS BACK TO DISCLOSE A GORILLA SNIPER in immediate f.g., crouching behind a boulder near the water. He sights his rifle at the man on the trail. Taylor is still too distant to make a sure target, and so the sniper waits. 370

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

Seizing the ape around the neck with his left arm. Taylor drives the muzzle of his pistol into Zaius' kidney. He spins Zaius around, using him as a shield. 381
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him to pull back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cease fire! Withdraw! His command echoes from the west wall of the canyon. 382
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (a hoarse cry)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM THEIR P.O.V. The sniper emerges from behind a boulder near the shore, and walks off along the beach. 383
direction.name: direction
