direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move off down the trail. 384
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I ought to kill you right now. (nudging him) Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Zira rushes down the trail to Lucius, who is sprawled on the ground. He has a bloody nose and a lump on his forehead. Nova and Cornelius come next, then Taylor, prodding Zaius ahead of him at gun point. Lucius appears to be more humiliated than hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not everything. They left a hostage. (a pause) How do you feel, Lucius?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deliver the message. Lucius looks to Taylor for confirmation. Taylor nods. The young ape hurries away through the rocks. Taylor crosses to a useless saddle, picks up a coil of rope, gestures at Zaius, indicating a nearby tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius squats on the ground beside the tree. Taylor sets his rifle against the trunk, fashions a noose and places it around Zaius' neck. Then, using an ingenious combination of knots, he ties Zaius' hands behind his back, and finally fastens the rope around the base of the tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minister of Science - let me explain certain principle stress and strain. If you exert pressure to remove these bonds, you'll choke yourself to death. It'll be suicide, you see? Zira and Cornelius look down at the captive mandarin. Their rebellious spirit has evaporated, and they are clearly afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor, please -- don't treat him that way.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They took me by surprise. Sneaked up on me while I was watering the horses. What's happened to honor? (pause, glum) I got off one round to warn you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gloomingly) They've taken everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Disillusioned... (turning on) But vindicated! I've been right all along. You can't trust the older generation. It's a matter of values -- TAYLOR (gently) All right, all right. Will You do me a favor? No orders.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pause) What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want you to go around the bend and tell those gorillas their leader is my prisoner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thoughtfull pause) Yes, I can do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. Say I want a week's supply of food for the woman and myself. A horse. A spade. And fifty rounds of ammunition.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if they won't agree to your terms?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then tell them Dr. Zaius won't leave here alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked) Taylor, you can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Calmly) Oh yes he can. He's a born killer. (to Lucius)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down. Over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as he works) Now,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's humiliating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wasn't I humiliated? By all of you? Didn't you lead me around on a leash?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was different. We thought you were .... inferior.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wintry smile) And now you know the truth. (to Zaius) Cornelius has beaten you, Doctor. He proved it. Man preceded you here. You owe him your science, your language, whatever knowledge you have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Then answer this: If ran was superior, why didn't he survive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugging) He might have been wiped out by a plague. Natural catastrophe. Like a fiery storm of meteors. From the looks of this part of your planet, I'd say that was a fair bet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (weakly) But we can't be sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating Zaius) He is. He knew all the time. Long before your discovery, he knew. (to Zaius) Defender of the Faith. Guardian of the terrible secret. Isn't that right, doctor? 385- 388
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FAVORING ZAIUS As Zira and Cornelius look at him expectantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius crosses to Zaius, and takes a small book bound in black leather from the breast pocket of his tunic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius thumbs through the book, finds the citation and reads aloud:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius falls silent and looks down at Zaius.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What I know of man was written long ago -- set down by the wisest ape of all -- our Lawgiver. (to Cornelius) Open my breast pocket.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Read it to him: the twentythird Scroll, ninth Verse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Beware the beast man, for he is the devil's pawn. Alone among God's primates, he kills for sport, or lust or greed. Yes, he will murder his brother to possess his brother's land. Let him not breed in great numbers, for he will make a desert of his home and yours. Shun him. Drive him back into his jungle lair: For he is the harbinger of death'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) I found nothing in the cave to alter that conception of man. And I still live by its injunction. A-389
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lucius hurries out of the rocks leading a saddled horse. Zaius' five mounted gorillas appear behind him. Taylor calls out to them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are! Lucius comes up with the horse. Taylor checks the provisions in the saddlebags. Lucius is frowning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor mounts the horse, extends a helping hand to Nova, who vault's nimbly onto the horse's rump. Taylor looks at Zira and Cornelius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches down, grasps Cornelius' hand, then grins crookedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor smiles, leans down, kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He extends his hand to Lucius, who takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor looks piercingly at Zaius, more troubled than offended.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stay where you
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They think you're behaving foolishly. I must say I agree. Where will you go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding o.s.) I'll start by following the shoreline. (a smile) And my nose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But suppose you find nothing but a wasteland. How will you survive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (firmly) He won't survive. (all look at him) Do you know what sort of life awaits you out there, Taylor? That of an animal. If you aren't eventually hunted down and killed by apes, some jungle beast will devour you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then there is another jungle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs; then, sardonically) Of course, you could return with us. Our society might find a place for you and your mate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where else, but in a cage, does man belong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, thanks. I'll take freedom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like to come along?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's better than going to prison for heresy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They can't convict us of that. You proved our innocence. Besides... (indicating Zaius) ... his culture is our culture.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good luck then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Zira, I'd like to kiss you good-bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, but.... (tears in her eyes) ...you're so damned ugly!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Go with God, Taylor. (half smile) That's an old expression. it comes from both ape and man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God bless you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lucius.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think you're making a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the boy. Keep 'em flying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The flags of discontent. It's the only way anything ever gets changed. (to Zaius) Don't try to follow us. (pats stock of his rifle) I'm pretty handy with things like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of that I'm sure. All my life I've awaited your coming and dreaded it. Like death itself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? From the first, I've terrified you, Doctor. And in spite of every sign that I'm an intelligent being who means no harm, you continue to hate and fear me. Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly, without rancor) Because you are a man. And you were right -- I have always known about man. From the evidence, I believe his wisdom must walk hand in hand with his idiocy. His emotions must rule his brain. He must be a warlike animal who gives battle to everything around him -- even himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What evidence? No weapons were found in the cave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Forbidden Zone was once a paradise. Your breed made a desert of it, ages ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he waits, then wearily) We're back at the beginning. I still don't know the why. A planet where apes evolved from men. A world turned wrong side up. A puzzle with one piece missing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Don't look for it, Taylor. You may not like what you find. B-389
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TAYLOR AND THE GROUP Taylor shakes his head, still baffled, digs his heels into the horse's flank. It canters off along the sandy shore.        Zira, Cornelius and Lucius sadly watch the departure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius moves quickly to remove the rope from Zaius' neck. Behind them, the five mounted gorillas gallop forward. Zaius gets up, waves them to a halt.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Untie me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no! Let him go! C-389
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Taylor looks back, sees that Zaius has stopped the mounted apes, slows his horse to a trot, smiles at Nova. 390-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius watches as Taylor's horse moves farther away along the beach. Then he turns to an ape called MARCUS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He remounts his horse and rides o.s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornelius throws himself at Zaius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius looks emptily at one of his apes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hairy hand is clapped over Cornelius' mouth. He is dragged off, struggling, kicking. Julius, unafraid, glares at Zaius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zaius looks benevolently at Julius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius and Zira look at each other, befuddled. Once more their eyes follow the retreating figures of Taylor and Nova. The beach separating the water from the canyon becomes narrower as they move downstream.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Fetch your explosives. We're going to seal the cave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (aghast) Seal the cave?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's correct. And you will both stand trial for heresy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But the proof? The doll?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In a few minutes there will be no doll. There can't be. (honest regret) I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mustn't! You gave your 'word!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What I do, I do with no pleasure. Silence him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Zaius, this is inexcusable! Why must knowledge stand still? What about the future?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I may just have saved it for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What will he find out there, doctor? A-406
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: His face is A mask, his tone enigmatic.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: His destiny. B-406
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TIE APES P.O.V. A moment later, as they watch, Taylor and Nova vanish around the bend. 407-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PALISADE AND BEACH - LONG HIGH ANGLE SHOT - DAY Taylor and Nova are already far downstream. There is a striking change in the terrain. The area is still desolate,but some vegetation can be seen on the palisade above the narrow beach, and the river has widened to form a vast tidal basin where it meets the sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : If feasible at new location site, this scene should be shot at high tide, so that the water laps at the base of the cliffs, making a passage difficult and risky. 410
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - PANNING WITH TAYLOR AND NOVA ON HORSEBACK He is alert, sniffing the salt air, sizing up the situation. Hearing the CRIES of birds, he reins in and looks' up. 411
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sea gulls are soaring overhead. 412
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His expression is expectant, searching. Nova emits a whimper of anticipation, pointing off. 413
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A verdant forest atop a distant palisade. Their view of the beach below the forest, is cut off by a rocky promontory in the middle distance. 414
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles at her hopefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The horse moves off at a trot, CAMERA PANNING. But they have gone only a short distance when they hear the distant THUNDER of an EXPLOSION. Taylor reins in and looks back. 415
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Nova -- I see it. (looks again at forest) In my old profession green meant safe. Green meant go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A column of smoke and dust rises from the exploded cave far upstream. 416
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frowning with concern, Taylor gazes for a moment at the smoke, then decides this is no time to linger. He digs his heels into the horse's flanks and they move off at a canter, riding toward the promontory that splits the beach. They are nearing the promontory that blocks their view of the beach beyond. 417-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - TRACKING WITH TAYLOR AND NOVA. As they round the promontory, the tip of a strange rock formation comes into view. it appears to be jutting from the sea. 420
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reins in momentarily, baffled by what he sees. Then he rides on. 421
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - AS SEEN BY TAYLOR An immense column juts from the beach at a thirty-degree angle. We can now see that it is not rock, but metal. Green metallic tints show through its gray salt-stained surface. As we draw closer, the object takes on the appearance of a massive arm, its top shaped like a hand holding a torch. 422
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frowning with consternation. His horse proceeds at a slow walk. 423
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WHAT HE SEES: Near the base of the column, where the shore and water meet, are a row of metal spikes. From this angle they look like tank traps. A-423
direction.name: direction
